name: Libya
description: Libya, officially the Arab Republic of Libya, is a country located in North Africa. It borders six countries: Tunisia to the northwest, Algeria to the west, Chad and Niger to the south, and Egypt to the east. The country is characterized by vast deserts, including the Sahara, and features a Mediterranean coastline. Libya possesses significant oil reserves, which have historically shaped its economy and political landscape. Despite recent political instability, Libya boasts a rich cultural heritage, evident in its ancient ruins, traditional music, and diverse tribal communities.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: The bustling capital and largest city of Libya, a major port and commercial center.
quickFacts.detail: Tripoli is known for its Ottoman-era architecture, vibrant souks (markets), and historical significance as a Phoenician and Roman settlement.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: Libya's population is a diverse mix of Arabs, Berbers, Egyptians, and other ethnicities.
quickFacts.detail: The population density is relatively low, with most people concentrated along the coast and in major cities.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: Libya is the tenth-largest country in Africa.
quickFacts.detail: Approximately 90% of the country is covered by the Sahara Desert.

quickFacts.label: Official Language
quickFacts.detail: Several dialects of Arabic are spoken throughout the country.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.detail: The Libyan Dinar is pegged to the US dollar.

quickFacts.label: GDP
quickFacts.description: Libya's economy is heavily reliant on oil exports.
quickFacts.detail: Recent political instability has significantly impacted the country's economic growth.

climateData.title: Climate of Libya
climateData.description: Libya experiences a hot desert climate with extreme temperature variations. Summers are scorching, while winters are mild, especially along the coast. Rainfall is scarce, primarily concentrated during the winter months.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Summer (June - August)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: The hottest period of the year, characterized by intense heat and humidity.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Winter (December - February)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Mild temperatures, particularly along the Mediterranean coast. Rainfall is more frequent during this season.
activities: Hiking in the Jebel Akhdar mountains

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Spring/Autumn (March - May & September - November)
seasonalCharacteristics.period: March to May & September to November
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Pleasant temperatures and comfortable conditions, ideal for outdoor activities.

naturalWonders.name: Jebel Akhdar (Green Mountain)
naturalWonders.description: Jebel Akhdar, meaning 'Green Mountain,' is a stunning mountain range in the central Nafusa Mountains, known for its terraced farms, ancient villages, and dramatic landscapes.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The mountains are characterized by fertile valleys carved into the rock, producing olives, almonds, and citrus fruits. The area is rich in Berber culture and history, with numerous traditional villages offering a glimpse into a bygone era.
viewingTips: Hire a local guide to explore the villages

naturalWonders.name: Siwa Oasis
naturalWonders.description: Siwa Oasis is a remote and ancient oasis in the Western Desert, renowned for its unique culture, stunning landscapes, and ancient ruins.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The oasis is centered around Lake Siwa, a saltwater lake with therapeutic properties. The area is home to a distinct Berber community that has preserved its traditions and customs for centuries. The ruins of Shali, a mud-brick fortress, offer a glimpse into the oasis's rich past.

ecosystemData.title: Ecosystems of Libya
ecosystemData.overview: Libya's ecosystems are primarily desert, with limited areas of coastal vegetation and oases. The Sahara Desert dominates the landscape, supporting a sparse but resilient flora and fauna.

biodiversityCategories.name: Desert Flora
biodiversityCategories.description: The flora of Libya's deserts is adapted to extreme conditions, including drought, high temperatures, and salinity.

statistics.details: Various species of cacti and succulents thrive in the arid environment.
Drought-resistant shrubs provide limited vegetation cover.

notableSpecies.name: Euphorbia
notableSpecies.significance: Succulent plant adapted to harsh conditions

biodiversityCategories.name: Coastal Vegetation
biodiversityCategories.description: Along the Mediterranean coast, a narrow band of vegetation exists, including shrubs, grasses, and some trees.

statistics.details: Cultivated in oases and along the coast.

activities.title: Activities in Libya
activities.description: Libya offers a range of outdoor activities, primarily focused on exploring its deserts and coast.

activityCategories.description: Explore the rugged mountains and desert landscapes on foot.

activities.name: Jebel Akhdar Trek
activities.description: Hike through the stunning landscapes of Jebel Akhdar, visiting Berber villages and exploring ancient ruins.
activities.requirements: Sturdy hiking boots, water, sunscreen, hat

activities.name: Siwa Oasis Hiking
activities.description: Explore the Siwa Oasis on foot, visiting the Shali ruins and Lake Siwa.

activityCategories.name: Desert Exploration
activityCategories.description: Experience the vastness and beauty of Libya's deserts.

activities.name: 4x4 Desert Safari
activities.description: Explore the desert in a 4x4 vehicle, visiting sand dunes and remote oases.

activities.name: Camel Trekking
activities.description: Experience the desert like the ancient nomads, trekking on camels.

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Enjoy the Mediterranean coastline with various water sports.

activities.name: Swimming
activities.description: Swim in the clear waters of the Mediterranean Sea.

activities.name: Snorkeling/Diving
